name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes: **Note:** Ignore extension from gallbladder to cystic duct.  Ignore extension to extrahepatic bile ducts or ampulla of Vater (T3) when other structures in T4 are involved.
rows: Tumor invades lamina propria or muscular layer

Invasive tumor confined to:
    Lamina propria
    Mucosa, NOS
    Submucosa (superficial invasion)

Stated as T1a

Tumor invades perimuscular connective tissue; no 
etension beyond serosa or into liver

Perimuscular connective tissue

Stated as T2

Tumor perforates the serosa (visceral peritoneum) andor
directly inves the liver and/or one other adjacent organ 
or structure, such as stomach, duodenum, colon, pancreas,
omentum, extrahepatic bile ducts

Invasion of/through serosa (visceral peritoneum)

Extension to:   
    Abdominal wall
    Ampulla of Vater
    Branch(es) of hepatic artery (right or left) but not into main portal vein or hepatic artery
    Branch(es) of portal vein (right or left)
    Cystic artery vein
    Diaphragm
    Small intestine

Extension into:
     Liver 

Stated as T3

Tumor invades main portal vein or hepatic artery or invades
two or more extrahepatic organs or structures

Extension to:
    Common hepatic artery
    Main portal vein
    Hepatic artery, NOS
    Portal vein, NOS

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
